blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Storage options controlling how storage properties are interpreted.

variables.name: SAVE_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to save cell-by-cell storage flow terms to the budget file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, storage flow terms (SS and SY contributions) are written to the cell-by-cell budget file defined in the Output Control package.

variables.name: STORAGECOEFFICIENT
variables.description: Keyword indicating that SS values are read as storage coefficient (dimensionless) rather than specific storage (1/length).
variables.tooltip: When specified, the SS array is interpreted as storage coefficient (S = Ss * thickness), which is dimensionless. By default, SS is specific storage with units of 1/length.

variables.name: SS_CONFINED_ONLY
variables.description: Keyword indicating that compressible storage is only active for confined cells.
variables.tooltip: When specified, specific storage contributions are only calculated for cells that are fully saturated (confined). This avoids double-counting storage changes in unconfined cells where specific yield already accounts for storage.

blocks.name: GRIDDATA
blocks.description: Storage property arrays for each cell.

variables.name: ICONVERT
variables.description: Integer flag indicating whether a cell is convertible (nonzero) or confined (0) for storage calculations.
variables.tooltip: Nonzero values indicate convertible cells that use specific yield (SY) when the water table is within the cell and specific storage (SS) when fully saturated. 0 indicates confined cells that always use SS.

variables.name: SS
variables.description: Specific storage (or storage coefficient if STORAGECOEFFICIENT is specified) for each cell.
variables.tooltip: Specific storage has units of 1/length and represents the volume of water released per unit volume per unit decline in head. Typical values range from 1e-6 to 1e-4 for confined aquifers.

variables.name: SY
variables.description: Specific yield (dimensionless) for each convertible cell.
variables.tooltip: Represents the volume of water released per unit area per unit decline in the water table. Only used for convertible cells (ICONVERT nonzero). Typical values range from 0.01 to 0.30.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period storage type designation (steady-state or transient).

variables.name: STEADY-STATE
variables.description: Keyword indicating the stress period is simulated as steady-state (no storage changes).
variables.tooltip: No storage terms are included in the flow equations for this stress period. Head distribution represents equilibrium conditions. Commonly used for the first stress period to establish initial conditions.

variables.name: TRANSIENT
variables.description: Keyword indicating the stress period is simulated as transient (storage changes are computed).
variables.tooltip: Storage terms (SS and SY) are included in the flow equations. Head changes over time as the aquifer responds to stresses. Requires appropriate time step discretization in TDIS.
